name: py-pbr

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
PBR is a library that injects some useful and sensible default behaviors
into your setuptools run.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-traceback2

dependent_to.name: py-munch

A Munch is a Python dictionary that provides attribute-style access (a
la JavaScript objects).

dependent_to.name: py-bandit
dependent_to.description: Security oriented static analyser for python code.

dependent_to.name: py-linecache2
dependent_to.description: Backports of the linecache module

dependent_to.name: py-oslo-config
dependent_to.description:
The Oslo configuration API supports parsing command line arguments and
.ini style configuration files.

dependent_to.name: py-lockfile
dependent_to.description:
The lockfile package exports a LockFile class which provides a simple
API for locking files. Unlike the Windows msvcrt.locking function, the
fcntl.lockf and flock functions, and the deprecated posixfile module,
the API is identical across both Unix (including Linux and Mac) and
Windows platforms. The lock mechanism relies on the atomic nature of the
link (on Unix) and mkdir (on Windows) system calls. An implementation
based on SQLite is also provided, more as a demonstration of the
possibilities it provides than as production-quality code.

dependent_to.name: py-git-review
dependent_to.description: git-review is a tool that helps submitting git branches to gerrit

dependent_to.name: py-oslo-utils
dependent_to.description:
The oslo.utils library provides support for common utility type

and time handling.

return its contents as a dictionary of NumPy arrays

dependent_to.name: py-oslo-i18n

The oslo.i18n library contain utilities for working with

dependent_to.name: py-virtualenvwrapper
dependent_to.description:
virtualenvwrapper is a set of extensions to Ian Bicking's virtualenv
tool. The extensions include wrappers for creating and deleting virtual
environments and otherwise managing your development workflow, making it
easier to work on more than one project at a time without introducing
conflicts in their dependencies.

dependent_to.name: py-stevedore
dependent_to.description: Manage Dynamic Plugins for Python Applications.

dependent_to.name: py-mock
dependent_to.description:
mock is a library for testing in Python. It allows you to replace parts
of your system under test with mock objects and make assertions about
how they have been used.

dependent_to.name: py-requests-unixsocket
dependent_to.description: Use requests to talk HTTP via a UNIX domain socket.

dependent_to.name: py-os-service-types

dependent_to.name: py-oslo-serialization
dependent_to.description:
The oslo.serialization library provides support for representing

dependent_to.name: py-panedr

dependent_to.name: py-debtcollector

A collection of Python deprecation patterns and strategies that help
you collect your technical debt in a non-destructive manner.
